intro: Codonechites, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are herbaceous annuals or perennials. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lobed or toothed, and they produce small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. Codonechites species are native to regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. They are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
